column2: n a monarchy in northwestern Europe occupying most of the British Isles; divided into England and Scotland and Wales and Northern Ireland; `Great Britain' is often used loosely to refer to the United Kingdom
n. a nation in northern North America; the French were the first Europeans to settle in mainland Canada

n North American republic containing 50 states - 48 conterminous states in North America plus Alaska in northwest North America and the Hawaiian Islands in the Pacific Ocean; achieved independence in 1776
n the army of the United States of America; the agency that organizes and trains soldiers for land warfare

n. a communist nation that covers a vast territory in eastern Asia; the most populous country in the world
n. high quality porcelain originally made only in China

obj. This or that female; the woman understood or referred to;
   the animal of the female sex, or object personified as feminine, which
   was spoken of.
obj. A woman; a female; -- used substantively.
n. a learner who is enrolled in an educational institution
n. the contractile aperture in the center of the iris of the eye; resembles a large black dot
n. the 5th letter of the Hebrew alphabet

n. a person whose occupation is teaching
n. a personified abstraction that teaches

n. a friendly informal reference to a grown man
n. (ethnic slur) offensive and disparaging term for Black man

conj. A particle which expresses the relation of connection or
   addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a
   clause, or a sentence with a sentence.
conj. In order to; -- used instead of the infinitival to,
   especially after try, come, go.
conj. It is sometimes, in old songs, a mere expletive.
conj. If; though. See An, conj.

n. a young woman
